title: Emmerdale spoilers: Nate is Cain's son in shock twist but who is mum?
text:
Cain Dingle’s (Jeff Hordley) life had already been turned upside down by the revelation that his beloved wife Moira (Natalie J Robb) has been cheating on him with farm hand Nate Robinson (Jurell Carter) in Emmerdale – but another bombshell was about to come his way.

As previously predicted by a number of fans, Nate revealed to Cain during a fight that he is actually his son – and he appeared to refer to Zak’s (Steve Halliwell) long forgotten and never before seen son Nathaniel.

Nathaniel was previously referred to in the show in 1995, before it was revealed that Cain’s ‘uncle’ Zak was actually his dad. But now it transpires that Cain has another son – and it’s a guy who is very much out to get him as he has deliberately seduced Moira and also tried to get him to lose custody of Kyle.

It seems to have hit Faith (Sally Dexter) pretty hard too as she found evidence of who Nate is in his caravan and to say she looked troubled is an understatement.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Cain was half way towards killing Nate during their vicious fight when Nate chucked in that bombshell before barking at a hysterical Moira that her use was over – he had only ever been sleeping with her to destroy Cain.

Emmerdale is remaining secretive over exactly how Nate fits in to the Dingle family tree and who his mother is – as well as whether Cain actually knew he had a long lost son in the first place. There is also the chance that Nate is lying but judging by Faith’s reaction, this seems unlikely.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

There’s a lot still to be explained but all three still have to make it out of this mess alive – we have left Moira struggling fo life at the bottom of the lake and the boat carrying Cain and Nate is about to blow up.

Right now, paternity seems the least pressing matter…

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Cain gets the daddy of all shocks.
